title: White goods firm Pacifica sees turnover soar to £24.3m after year of investment
text:
White goods firm Pacifica sees turnover soar to £24.3m after year of investment The Chester-le-Street repair services company also took on an extra 58 staff during their last financial year Share Cllr Harry Trueman, deputy leader of Sunderland City Council with Pacifica Groups Scott Pallister, financial director and Kevin Brown, managing director (Photo: Unknown) Share Get business   Thank you for subscribing!   
White goods specialist Pacifica boosted turnover to £24.2m following a strong year in which it grew its workforce by more than a quarter. 
Pacifica became the 650th firm to receive investment from the Finance for Business North East (FBNE) programme in 2014, as well as a grant from The Journal’s Let’s Grow pot of money from the Government’s Regional Growth Fund. 
As part of the funding the Chester-le-Street firm laid out plans to create a raft of jobs, and latest accounts for the year ended March 31 2016 show the firm hired an extra 58 members of staff in that time period. 
Pacifica specialises in repairing and replacing washing machines, fridges and cookers as well as gas appliances and central heating systems. 
The company works for a number of local authorities, housebuilders, and landlords as well as private customers. 
Kevin Brown, one of Pacifica’s directors, said in the company’s accounts: “The business has grown through word of mouth and through reputation within our sectors. Group turnover is £24m with the majority driven within the UK. 
“The group will continue to focus on its core objectives, ‘to be the best at what we do’, and ‘to deliver world class services to our customers’. 
“This involves both improving the efficiency of service delivery and increasing both customer satisfaction and profitability. 
“We expect to see strong results for 2016/17 both in terms of sales growth and in terms of profitability.” Read More 
The firm’s turnover grew by 17.9%, from £20.6m in 2015 to £24.3m last year and headcount increased from 213 to 271 members of staff, a rise of 27%. 
Operating profit also grew by 48% from £511,681 to £761,946. 
The company’s profit for the financial year fell by £139,000 to £338,000, a fall the firm said was caused by its reduction in its investment in Pacifica Home Services Limited, from 100% to 75%. 
Pacifica moved its warehouse distribution centre to Washington after receiving £250,000 investment from The Journal’s Let’s Grow grant, which is run by The Journal in association with BE Group and accountants UNW. After receiving the cash injection Pacifica pledged to grow its turnover from £22m to over £30m within three years. 
The latest results means Pacifica needs to grow its revenues by less than £6m over the next two years to hit its target. 
In the accounts Mr Brown also revealed that the company intends to increase its emphasis on the business to consumer (B2C) market. B2C sales currently make up 8% of the business’ income but the firm plans to grow this to 50% over the coming years. Like us on Facebook
